dcterms:description: A set of 1000 independent sky model images generated from cosmological MHD simulations, representing diffuse radio emission. These images are used as the primary dataset for training the autoencoder.
dcterms:title: Sky images

dcterms:description: Images generated by adding pure random noise to the Sky images, simulating the noise expected in realistic observations.
dcterms:title: Noise images

dcterms:description: Images resulting from the cleaning process applied to the Sky images, which includes the effects of the instrumental response and aims to remove noise and artefacts.
dcterms:title: Clean images

dcterms:description: Raw images resulting from the imaging procedure, affected by noise and artefacts before any cleaning process.
dcterms:title: Dirty images

dcterms:description: Models created to simulate realistic observations, incorporating various physical processes and perturbations to generate mock radio images.
dcterms:title: Mock Sky models
